title: As a MNC Admin, I want EBIS to automatically create Add Cs when a player is Optioned or Outrighted During Season
custom_steps:
AC

* When a player has an Optional Assignment or MJ/MN Outright Transaction approved, the system will automatically create a new Add C for the player
** There is currently a rule check in place, but this will need to be updated to ensure the Add C has the correct salary
** *Insert logic here*
* These Add Cs will be created in Tendered state
* The Assignment Date will be used as the signing date, unless it is a postgame assignment, then use the following day
* These Add C will be displayed in the Add C widget
* If a player is missing a MNC, they will appear in the Add C widget and will be displayed as needing a contract

title: As a MNC Admin, I don't want any Add C process changes for DSL Players
custom_steps:
AC:

* Add Cs will not be autocreated for DSL Players
* These players will all appear in the Add C widget
* Add Cs will be created and tendered from the Add C widget



Note: no new changes are required for this, just ensuring nothing impacts existing functionality

title: As a MNC Admin, I want MN Payroll Dates Updated
custom_steps:
AC:

* Dates on the System Dates screen will be reordered to:
** Winter Training Period
** Spring Training Period
** Fall Period
* The 'training period' dates are going to be maximum possible length for the period. As such:
** The Winter period is the first one in the year.  It goes from January 2nd until the day before spring training period starts
** The Spring period is next and goes from 2/15(ish) through to when the last league starts (complex league, in June)
** The Fall period starts around 8/23 and runs through until the 'dead period' - friday before thanksgiving

title: Reports Dashboard - Add Rules & Regulations to Create New dropdown menu
custom_steps:
AC:

* Go to the Reports page and select the MLB Documents tab (see: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1732|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1732|smart-link] )
* At the bottom of the widget, select the Create New dropdown arrow
** The dropdown options should include â€œRules & Regulationsâ€�

title: As a MNC Admin, I want how payment rates are determined updated
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a player is on a team that is in season, each day will be counted as a championship season day and they will be payed the championship season rate
* If a player is on a team that is currently in the playoffs, each day will be counted as a playoff day and they will be payed the playoff season rate
*  If a player is on a team that is not in season, and the date falls during one of the training periods (system dates), each day will be counted for the respective period and they will receive pay for that day
** The pay received on each off season day is dependant on whether or player is reported or not:
*** If the the player is reported, they get paid at the offseason - reported (or spring training) rate (system value)
*** If the the player is not reported, they get paid at the offseason rate (system value)

title: As a MNC Admin, I don't want Outrighted players to be paid a MN Salary if MJC is still valid
custom_steps:
AC:

* If a player is outrighted, they should not receive any MN pay (display $0) until their MJC is expired
** Expiration will happen on the Tender Date and will be handled by the MJC Expiration Batch
** Players will continue earning their MJ Pay / P2 Salary until EOS
** Once the MJC is expired, MN pay will start
** If a player is on a MY MJC and still has years left, their MJC will not expire. They will continue to be marked as Outright and not receive any MN Pay

For clarification, there is a period of time where these players are not paid at either level.  the MJ Pay stops at EOS and then the MN Pay doesn't kick in until the MJC is expired (as part of the MJC Expiration Batch).  Tender Date/MJC Expiration Date is the same day as the last day of the Fall Training period. However, players should not receive MN Pay for this day. The next day they get paid should be the start of the Winter Training Period.

title: As a MNC Admin, I don't want salaries displayed for DSL players during training periods
custom_steps:
AC:

* Players assigned to the DSL will not have salaries displayed in the MN Payroll utility for any period outside of the Championship Season and Playoffs
** All training periods will display $0

title: As a MNC Admin, I want EBIS to automatically create Add Cs when a player is Optioned or Outrighted During Spring Training
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a player has an Optional Assignment or MJ/MN Outright Transaction approved, the system will automatically create a new Add C for the player using the system value of MN Min (No MLS) or the P2 salary, which ever is lower
** These transactions must be submitted after the Tender Deadline and before the start of the season
* The Add Cs will be created in Tender state
* These Add Cs will be visible in the Add C widget

title: As a MNC Admin, I want Add Cs autocreated when players are transferred from DSL to Domestic Affiliate
custom_steps:
AC:

* When a Transfer tx from the DSL to a domestic affilliate is approved, the system will create a new domestic Add C (using stored salary amounts from the CBA)
* These Add Cs, will be consistent with the Add Cs that are autocreated by the batch in January
* These Add Cs will not appear in the Add C widget

title: As a MNC Admin, I want Add Cs for Attachment 43 player to be auto created
custom_steps:
AC:

* When the new [Add C batch|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1744] is run in January, Add Cs for all players considered Attachment 43 players will be created
** Attachment 43 players are defined as:
*** (a) Having at least one day of MLS during any championship season
*** (b) Outrighted anytime after Labor Day
**** There will be a new system date to track this [Attachment 43 Date Outright Date]
* The salary on the auto-generated C will be 80% of the salary in the playerâ€™s most recent C OR the minimum salary for MN Players w/ >= 1 day of MLS (system value), which ever is greater
** In the event that a MJ player is outrighted after Labor Day and never has a Add C for the year, the new C may not be less than 80% of the P2 Salary in the MJC
* The new Add Cs will be created in Tendered state

!image-20230821-205224.png|width=816,height=1085!

title: As  a MNC Admin, I want a Recalc Payrolls button
custom_steps:
Context: In the event that system dates or club dates change, the MN Payroll utility will need to get recalculated



AC:

* BOC Admin Users will see a â€œRecalc Payrollsâ€� button at the top of the MN Payrolls screen
* Clicking this button will recalculate payrolls for all MN players using the newly updated system dates

title: As a MNC Admin, I want Non-FY MNCs that were Signed prior to the mCBA displayed in the Add C widget
custom_steps:
Context: Non-First Year Multi-year MNCs that were signed before the MN CBA went into effect (4/1/23) still need to have an Add C signed every year the contract is in effect

AC:

* Non-First Year Multi-Year MNCs, that were approved prior to 4/1/23, and are still in effect (not expired, terminated, etc) will be displayed in the Add C widget
* There will be no process changes to these contracts, Add Cs will still need to be created, tendered, sent for esign from the Add C widget

title: As a Intl Admin, I want to merge multiple unverified profiles at the same time
custom_steps:
Context: When prospects are created in AMT, a profile is automatically created in EBIS.  Because of this, there are often several profile created for the same player.  Needing to merge all these profile one by one is very time consuming for the registration analysts.

AC:

* Users will be able to select multiple (more than 2) Unregistered international amateur profiles on the Reg Admin widget and click merge
* A modal will be displayed allowing the user to choose which profile should be the master and proceed with the merge
** All expected system updates will occur
* If a registered player is selected (any reg status other than Unregistered), the system will return a blocking message:
** Title: Error
** Body: You have selected a registered player.  Bulk merge may not be used with registered players.
** Buttons: Back

title: Change MNC delete from a physical delete to a logical delete
custom_steps:
Instead of deleting the entire minor contract, change the state on the MNC to â€˜deletedâ€™.  We already added a deleted state to the status lkup (for ebis link purposes).  

All places that search for MNCs should ignore the deleted status (so this will be a fairly large undertaking).

List all places where contracts are found in the comments for this Jira so that prod val can verify.

title: Convert all Club UEC Admin Permissions to UEC Viewers in Bulk
custom_steps:
On 10/31, we will need to run a SQL to mass update all Club Users with UEC Admin Permission to be UEC Viewers.  No Club User should be able to Create, Submit, Update any UEC after this SQL is run in production.



* Please remove the follow roles from ALL accounts:
** ebis-empc-club-executive-creator-role
** ebis-empc-club-field-personnel-creator-role
** ebis-empc-club-front-office-creator-role
** ebis-empc-club-scouting-creator-role
* Please convert ebis-empc-club-executive-admin-role to ebis-empc-club-executive-viewer-role
* Please convert ebis-empc-club-field-personnel-admin-role to ebis-empc-club-field-personnel-viewer-role
* Please convert ebis-empc-club-front-office-admin-role to ebis-empc-club-front-office-viewer-role
* Please convert ebis-empc-club-scouting-admin-role to ebis-empc-club-scouting-viewer-role

custom_steps:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1582|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1582|smart-link] 

AC:

* On the Add B portion of Non-First Year Minor Contracts, the â€œMajor League Spring Training Inviteâ€� will once again be an option
* This provision will work as expected, with regard to Yes/No toggles, trash cans, add terms, language, etc.

title: Reports Dashboard - Want a new MLB Documents tab & widget
custom_steps:
See: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~71202025ea13ce68574e4e81f839a847d2e138/pages/3091333194/Data+Discovery+-+MLB+Documents|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~71202025ea13ce68574e4e81f839a847d2e138/pages/3091333194/Data+Discovery+-+MLB+Documents|smart-link] 

AC:

* Go to the Reports pageÂ 
* To the right of the â€œBlank Formsâ€� tab will be a â€œMLB Documentsâ€� tab
* Selecting this button will take you to the MLB Documents widget
* There will be two dropdown menus at the top of the widget, next to the widget title - MLB Documents:
** All categories - default option
*** Rules & Regulations
*** Transactions
** Active - default option
*** Inactive
* There will be one button at the bottom of the widget:
** Create New - with a dropdown arrow showing the options:
*** Form
*** Form Type
*** Language
** The possible actions of these options should mirror: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~71202025ea13ce68574e4e81f839a847d2e138/pages/3092480023/Data+Discovery+-+Add+New+Form+Form+Type+Form+Language+Form+Rules+Regulations+popups|https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~71202025ea13ce68574e4e81f839a847d2e138/pages/3092480023/Data+Discovery+-+Add+New+Form+Form+Type+Form+Language+Form+Rules+Regulations+popups|smart-link] 
* There will be two additional columns to the left of the â€œCategoryâ€� column that will allow the user to either edit the selected row or delete the selected row
** Upon selecting the option to edit the row, the Create New button at the bottom of the widget will be replaced with the buttons: Save, Cancel All Changes

title: As a MNC Admin, I want to see both days reported and payment days on the MN Payroll Screens
custom_steps:
Wire: [https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=mn_payroll_-_boc&c=1|https://7xflwf.axshare.com/#g=1&p=mn_payroll_-_boc&c=1|smart-link] 

AC:

* In the Player Summary portion of the MN Payroll screen and in the player profile widget, day will be expressed as X(Y)
** X will be the number of days the player was reported and received payment during the period
** Y will be the total number of days the player was on an applicable roster during the period
** Example: If a player is on a 3A team for 20 days during the Winter Training period and is â€œreportedâ€� for 15 of them, his days will be represented as 15(20)
* There will be a hover added for the days column that explains the breakdown
** For the above example, the hover will read â€œ15 days reported, 10 total days on rosterâ€�
